subject: Move Redfish BMC reboot function to common library
commitMessage:
Move Redfish BMC reboot function to common library

Resolves:
    https://github.com/openbmc/openbmc-test-automation/issues/2137

Signed-off-by: Prashanth Katti <prkatti1@in.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I996860491c9498da22323782ae2a292f4c274482

comments.message:
Patch Set 1: Ok-To-Test+1

User approved, CI ok to start

Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build Successful 

https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/31659/ : SUCCESS

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I believe we shouldn't add it in the lib, it was cater to the specific test case.  Use the Redfish Reboot if needed in general.

Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> 
> I believe we shouldn't add it in the lib, it was cater to the specific test case.  Use the Redfish Reboot if needed in general.

Ohh OK, I thought that `Redfish reboot` is not there.
Why are we not using that here??
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/openbmc-test-automation/+/49280/4/redfish/managers/test_bmc_protocol_settings.robot

Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> > Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> > 
> > I believe we shouldn't add it in the lib, it was cater to the specific test case.  Use the Redfish Reboot if needed in general.
> 
> Ohh OK, I thought that `Redfish reboot` is not there.
> Why are we not using that here??
> https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/openbmc-test-automation/+/49280/4/redfish/managers/test_bmc_protocol_settings.robot

This is also a good technic of doing the real reset check. Good to have a different flavour here but inside the suite.

> > https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/openbmc-test-automation/+/49280/4/redfish/managers/test_bmc_protocol_settings.robot
> 
> This is also a good technic of doing the real reset check. Good to have a different flavour here but inside the suite.

We have persistency check in multiple suites, instead of adding it in each suite it is better to move it in library at one place.

> We have persistency check in multiple suites, instead of adding it in each suite it is better to move it in library at one place.

Any update on this??
Just triggering reset will not ensure successful reset/reboot.
We've many test cases & suites where we use reboot function so this code is needed in library.
